title: Apple sues NSO Group over spyware
description: Apple on Tuesday sued NSO Group and its parent company, accusing the Israeli firm of violating a federal anti-hacking law by selling potent software that clients have used to spy on Apple customers.

title: Mammoth tusk recovered from an unlikely place
description: Mammoths are long to be known as ancient land dwellers, so scientists were shocked to find remains from the animal at the bottom of the ocean.

title: Brian Laundrie autopsy shows he died by suicide
description: Brian Laundrie died by suicide from a gunshot wound to the head, an attorney for the Laundrie family told CNN on Tuesday.

title: Ring doorbell camera captures arrest of parade killings suspect
description: A Ring doorbell camera caught the moment that Darrell E. Brooks, the man who is accused of careening his SUV into a Wisconsin parade, was forced to surrender to police after trying to get help from a homeowner to call an Uber.

title: There may be something more going on with the Harris and Buttigieg gossip
description: The next presidential election is three years away. Recent reports about early concern over whether President Joe Biden will run for reelection in 2024 and about tension between potential 2024 rivals, Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg and Vice President Kamala Harris are, to some extent, standard Washington gossip that can be safely ignored. Still, there may be something more than that.

title: AstraZeneca CEO defends his vaccine after negative press
description: AstraZeneca's CEO responds to negative headlines surrounding its Covid-19 vaccine, defends its efficacy and urges governments to vaccinate people. The company, which has delivered 2 billion doses of the vaccine, will set different prices for different countries, according to CEO Pascal Soriot.

title: Man United through to Champions League knockout stage in first match under new boss
description: Manchester United started life without Ole Gunnar Solskjaer with a 2-0 victory against Villarreal on Tuesday courtesy of goals from Cristiano Ronaldo and Jadon Sancho.

title: US House members describe 'toxic' animosity between lawmakers
description: Many members within the House of Representatives have told CNN in recent days that they find themselves in a toxic work environment, wrought with bitter exchanges, threats and fears about what the erosion of decorum in the chamber will mean for a body that has still not recovered 10 months after the Capitol Hill riot.

title: Biden announces largest release of emergency oil in US history
description: President Joe Biden on Tuesday will announce the Department of Energy will release 50 million barrels of oil from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve as part of an effort to lower high gas prices and address the lack of oil supply around the world.

title: Employers can now be fined in this country for after hours calls
description: Portugal parliament has passed a law that will fine employers who call or text employees after working hours. CNN's Isa Soares reports.

title: Ancient human relative walked like a human but climbed like an ape, new fossils suggest
description: An ancient human relative was able to walk the ground on two legs and use their upper limbs to climb and swing like apes, according to a new study of 2 million-year-old vertebrae fossils.

title: Grammy nominations 2022: See the list of nominees
description: Nominations for the 2022 Grammy Awards are being revealed Tuesday.

title: Malikah Shabazz, the daughter of Malcolm X, has died, officials say
description: A daughter of slain Black civil rights activist Malcolm X, Malikah Shabazz, died Monday, the New York Police Department told CNN.

title: IOC accused of sportswashing in case of Chinese tennis star
IOC accused of sportswashing in case of Chinese tennis star
description: Human Rights Watch (HRW) has accused the International Olympic Committee (IOC) of sportswashing serious human rights violations in the case of Chinese tennis star Peng Shuai.

title: Airbus A340 plane lands on Antarctica for first time
description: For the first time in history, an Airbus A340 plane has landed on Antarctica.

title: French prime minister tests positive for Covid-19, forcing five Belgian ministers to isolate
Meredith Kercher's convicted killer released from prison
description: Rudy Guede, the only person to remain convicted over the murder of British student Meredith Kercher in Italy, has been released from prison, his lawyer Fabrizio Ballarini told CNN on Tuesday.

title: Bus fire in Bulgaria kills at least 45 people, including 12 children
description: At least 45 people have died after a passenger bus caught fire on a highway in western Bulgaria, according to state media.

title: 'Hellbound' is the new 'Squid Game'
description: South Korean dramas are killing it this year.

title: Flight attendant on unruly behavior: 'We're not willing to accept this as the new normal'
South Korean stars Park Shin-hye and Choi Tae-joon engaged and expecting a baby
description: South Korean stars Choi Tae-joon and Park Shin-hye have plenty to look forward to as the couple announced they are engaged to be married and have a baby on the way.

title: Prosecution rests closing argument rebuttal | Judge denies defense's motion for mistrial | Jury told it is unlawful to base a citizen's arrest on Facebook
The surprising reason why Ocean Spray cranberry sauce labels are upside-down
description: Perhaps one of the greatest mysteries of Thanksgiving is the cranberry sauce — and we're not talking about why people eat it: Why are the labels on Ocean Spray cans upside down?

title: Five-day work week is 'no longer fit for purpose,' CEO of UK bank says
description: A British bank has adopted a four-day work week for all its employees without cutting pay, saying it's the largest UK company so far to make such a move.

title: Jeff Bezos' rocket company, Blue Origin, to send Good Morning America host to edge of space
description: Jeff Bezos' rocket company, Blue Origin, announced that it would be launching Good Morning America host Michael Strahan to the edge of space. Strahan will be joined by the daughter of the first American astronaut and four paying customers.

title: 'Everybody had gotten sick of me': Jennifer Lawrence on why she stepped away from the spotlight
description: Jennifer Lawrence has revealed that she is "nervous" about returning to the spotlight after taking a step back when she felt "everybody had gotten sick of me."

title: Dollar Tree hikes prices 25%. Most items will cost $1.25
description: Dollar Tree will soon be $1.25 tree.

title: Breakfast is going to be more expensive next year
description: Expect to pay more for some of your favorite cereals, snacks, soups and cooking brands next year.

title: Soccer star says there was 'no racist intent' in banana comment captured in video
description: AS Roma player Felix Afena-Gyan says he believes there was "no racist intent" in a comment made by an unidentified person while the Ghanaian forward unboxed a new pair of shoes given to him by manager Jose Mourinho.

title: Newly-freed Sudan prime minister defends deal with military, says he made it to 'avoid bloodshed'
description: Sudan's newly reinstated prime minister told CNN on Tuesday that he compromised in a deal with the country's military in order to "avoid bloodshed" and a civil war.

title: Meteorites passed off as pyrite seized by Chinese customs
description: Almost half a metric ton of meteorites declared as pyrite ore on import have been seized by authorities in the southern city of Shenzhen, China's customs agency said on Monday.

title: How people in the US are experiencing 'climate racism'
description: CNN's Rene Marsh examines the link between the climate crisis and racial injustice in the US.

title: Defense lawyer prompts outrage for bringing up Ahmaud Arbery's toenails in closing arguments
description: A sentence uttered by a defense attorney in the trial of those accused in the killing of Ahmaud Arbery brought an audible gasp from people in the courtroom Monday -- and elicited outrage from his family and legal experts.

title: Ethiopia's Nobel Peace Prize-winning leader says he'll lead troops on front lines against rebels
description: Ethiopian Prime Minister and Nobel Peace Prize winner Abiy Ahmed has announced he will lead his country's soldiers on the front lines of the war against advancing rebel fighters, in the latest escalation of the year-long conflict between his government and rebel groups from the northern Tigray region.

title: Flight attendant on unruly behavior: 'We're not willing to accept this as the new normal'
description: Your checklist for airplane travel this holiday season: High quality, comfortable mask; hand sanitizer; early airport arrival; and easy to remove jacket, shoes, laptop and toiletries for the security checkpoint.

title: Sale of rare Einstein manuscript offers glimpse into the mind of a genius
description: Bidders at an auction in Paris are hoping to get their hands on a scientific manuscript which details a key stage in the development of Albert Einstein's theory of relativity.

title: Xiaomi's stumble allows Apple to reclaim No.2 spot in smartphones
description: Xiaomi stumbled in the third quarter as it grappled with fallout from the global chip shortage and fiercer competition.

title: 'There's power in that fear': Andrew Cuomo looms in the race to replace him
description: More than three months after he resigned in disgrace, former New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo exists in political limbo -- not completely written off as a spent force, but sidelined as the campaign to replace him heats up.

title: The West's leaders agree that democracy is under attack. How they can defend it is less obvious
description: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko's willful manipulation of migrants, enabling their easy passage to and through his country toward the border of the European Union, is a classic assault on democracy by an autocrat who knows that any attempt to fight back risks undermining the bloc's sacred values.

title: FIFA President Gianni Infantino sees 'great evolution' in Qatar amidst worker death reports
description: With just under a year to go until the Qatar 2022 World Cup, FIFA President Gianni Infantino said that he has seen "great evolution" in the Gulf country.

title: Colombia's indigenous activists protect the environment. Now they too are under threat
description: Fighting against climate change is often a matter of who controls the territory.

title: Sidewalk collapses during Brazil parade, sending 30 people into river
description: A sidewalk collapsed during Christmas festivities in the southeastern city of Joinville in Brazil on Monday, injuring 33 people, according to authorities.

title: Giant spiders invade the New York dining scene
description: Tried meatless Mondays? How about black fly Fridays or scorpion Sundays?

title: US warship again transits sensitive Taiwan Strait
description: A US warship again sailed through the sensitive Taiwan Strait on Tuesday, part of what the US military calls routine activity but which always riles China whose government believes Washington is trying to stir regional tensions.

title: Infectious-disease expert: What's happening with Covid in Europe is a 'social crisis'
description: Speaking with CNN's Rosemary Church, Peter Drobac, an infectious-disease and global health expert with Oxford University, shares his concern about the growing anti-vaccine sentiment across Europe as Covid-19 cases continue to rise.

title: Paytm is still struggling to convince investors after disastrous IPO
description: Paytm is starting to stage a recovery from its disastrous stock market debut last week, but the digital payments firm faces an uphill battle winning over investors worried about its ability to turn a profit in the face of growing competition.

title: UN criticizes arrest of rights activist in Indian Kashmir
description: Rights groups including the United Nations have criticized the arrest of a prominent activist in Indian-administered Kashmir on terror funding charges.

title: Stu Rasmussen, America's first openly transgender mayor, has died
description: Stewart "Stu" Rasmussen, America's first openly transgender mayor, has died, according to the current mayor of Silverton, Oregon, Kyle Palmer.

title: Analysis: Peng Shuai has finally appeared in public. But here's why the worries aren't going away
description: Almost as abruptly as she had vanished, Chinese tennis star Peng Shuai reappeared in public view over the weekend.

title: Suspect in Waukesha parade tragedy faces homicide charges
Atlanta-area man accused of killing a couple in their home and stabbing a police officer
description: An Atlanta-area man accused of stabbing a police officer during an attempted burglary last week has also been charged with murder in connection with the deaths of a firefighter and his wife, officials say.

title: Who won this year's 'Dancing with the Stars'?
description: A Peloton instructor, a former NBA star, a social media personality and a talk show host competed for the crown on the finale of "Dancing with the Stars."

title: Former South Korean military dictator Chun Doo-hwan dies at 90
description: Former South Korean President Chun Doo-hwan, whose iron-fisted rule of the country following a 1979 military coup sparked massive democracy protests, died on Tuesday at the age of 90, his former press aide said.

title: Trump's next January 6 circus looms after Stone and Jones are subpoenaed
description: Steve Bannon turned the January 6 committee into a politicized spectacle but Alex Jones and Roger Stone could conjure a theater of the absurd out of the probe into one of the most jarring assaults on democracy in US history.

title: Sandra Bullock's idea for an on-screen reunion with Keanu Reeves is pure excellence
description: Sandra Bullock has shared the big screen with Keanu Reeves twice -- but she's down for a third and even has an idea.

title: Amanpour to ex-diplomat: I hear you washing your hands of the country
description: CNN's Christiane Amanpour presses former US envoy to Afghanistan and Iraq Zalmay Khalilzad on women's rights after the US troops withdrawal.

title: At least 35 dead after heavy rain batters south India
description: At least 35 people have been killed and dozens more remain missing after heavy rains battered parts of southern India, destroying houses and flooding roads, officials said Monday.

title: Kyle Rittenhouse appears on Fox News with message to Biden
description: Kyle Rittenhouse appeared in a Fox News interview with Tucker Carlson where he responded to a Joe Biden campaign ad featuring him saying it was "defaming his character." CNN's Chris Cuomo and Van Jones discuss.

title: Arbery's mom leaves courtroom during 'disturbing' moment
description: In an interview with John Berman, Wanda Cooper-Jones, mother of Ahmaud Arbery, reacts to defense attorney Laura Hogue's comments about her son's "long, dirty toenails."

title: Intimate photos show lives of the rich and beautiful
description: Slim Aarons built a career documenting the lives of the rich and beautiful.

title: Awkward, lengthy pauses plague Johnson's speech
description: Described as "shambolic" by opposition lawmakers, British Prime Minister Boris Johnson delivered a rambling speech filled with awkward, lengthy pauses to the Confederation of British Industry on Monday as he faces scrutiny from the press over whether he's losing control of the government. Bianca Nobilo has more.

title: Charlottesville civil trial exposes rift between White nationalists
description: The civil trial for White nationalists who organized a two-day rally in Charlottesville, Virginia, in 2017 has exposed distrust among the defendants with fault lines emerging over using violence, how to dress and how polished to appear. CNN's Brian Todd reports.
